devdoc.details: A Realitio arbitrator implementation that uses Realitio v2.1 and Kleros. It notifies Realitio contract for arbitration requests and creates corresponding dispute on Kleros.  Transmits Kleros ruling to Realitio contract. Maintains crowdfunded appeals and notifies Kleros contract. Provides a function to submit evidence for Kleros dispute.  There is a conversion between Kleros ruling and Realitio answer and there is a need for shifting by 1. This is because ruling 0 in Kleros signals tie or no-ruling but in Realitio 0 is a valid answer.  For reviewers this should be a focus as it's quite easy to get confused. Any mistakes on this conversion will render this contract useless.  NOTE: This contract trusts the Kleros arbitrator and Realitio.

params._arbitrator: The address of the ERC792 arbitrator.
params._arbitratorExtraData: The extra data used to raise a dispute in the ERC792 arbitrator.
params._realitio: The address of the Realitio contract.

fundAppeal(uint256,uint256).details: TRUSTED. Manages crowdfunded appeals contributions and calls appeal function of the Kleros arbitrator to appeal a dispute.

params._questionID: Identifier of the Realitio question, casted to uint. This also serves as the local identifier in this contract.
params._ruling: The ruling option to which the caller wants to contribute to.

returns.fullyFunded: True if the ruling option got fully funded as a result of this contribution.

getDisputeFee(bytes32).details: Returns arbitration fee by calling arbitrationCost function in the arbitrator contract.

returns.fee: Arbitration fee that needs to be paid.

returns._DENOMINATOR: Multiplier denominator in basis points. Required for achieving floating-point-like behavior.
returns._LOSER_APPEAL_PERIOD_MULTIPLIER: Losers appeal period multiplier. The loser is given less time to fund its appeal to defend against last minute appeal funding attacks.

getTotalWithdrawableAmount(uint256,addre.details: Returns the sum of withdrawable amount.  This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds.  It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(m^2).

params._contributor: The contributor for which to query.
params._questionID: Identifier of the Realitio question, casted to uint. This also serves as the local identifier in this contract.
params._ruling: Ruling option to look for potential withdrawals.

returns.sum: The total amount available to withdraw.

numberOfRulingOptions(uint256).details: Returns number of possible ruling options. Valid rulings are [0, count].

reportAnswer(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,add.details: Reports the answer to a specified question from the Kleros arbitrator to the Realitio v2.1 contract.  This can be called by anyone, after the dispute gets a ruling from Kleros. We can't directly call `assignWinnerAndSubmitAnswerByArbitrator` inside `rule` because of last answerer is not stored on chain.

params._lastAnswerOrCommitmentID: The last answer given, or its commitment ID if it was a commitment, to the question in the Realitio contract, in bytes32.
params._lastAnswerer: The last answerer to the question in the Realitio contract.
params._lastHistoryHash: The history hash given with the last answer to the question in the Realitio contract.

requestArbitration(bytes32,uint256).details: Request arbitration from Kleros for given _questionID.

params._maxPrevious: If specified, reverts if a bond higher than this was submitted after you sent your transaction.
params._questionID: The question identifier in Realitio contract.

returns.disputeID: ID of the resulting dispute on arbitrator.

rule(uint256,uint256).details: Receives ruling from Kleros and enforces it.

params._ruling: Ruling that is given by Kleros. This needs to be converted to Realitio answer before reporting the answer by shifting by 1.

submitEvidence(uint256,string).details: Allows to submit evidence for a given dispute.

withdrawFeesAndRewards(uint256,address,u.details: Allows to withdraw any reimbursable fees or rewards after the dispute gets resolved.

params._contributor: The address whose rewards to withdraw.
params._questionID: Identifier of the Realitio question, casted to uint. This also serves as the local identifier in this contract.
params._roundNumber: The number of the round caller wants to withdraw from.
params._ruling: Ruling that received contribution from contributor.

returns.amount: The amount available to withdraw for given question, contributor, round number and ruling option.

withdrawFeesAndRewardsForAllRounds(uint2.details: Allows to withdraw any rewards or reimbursable fees after the dispute gets resolved. For all rounds at once.  This function has O(m) time complexity where m is number of rounds.  It is safe to assume m is always less than 10 as appeal cost growth order is O(2^m).

params._contributor: The address whose rewards to withdraw.
params._questionID: Identifier of the Realitio question, casted to uint. This also serves as the local identifier in this contract.
params._ruling: Ruling that received contributions from contributor.

devdoc.title: Realitio_v2_1_ArbitratorWithAppeals
